p:
The Baccam Model is based on in vivo experimental data and contains three variables: the number of susceptible and uninfected target (epithelial) cells T, the number of infected cells I, and the number of infectious-viral titer V. The dynamical behavior of the variables is given by the ODEs shown in Figure 2a. That is, target cells become infected and thus converted to infected cells at a rate
β T V
, infected cells die spontaneously at rate
δ I
, virus proliferates at a rate
p I
and dies at a rate
c V
. The parameters
β
,
δ
, p and c are, as usual, positive real numbers (cf. [ 13] for actual values).
